arm_group.description: higher flow rates endoscopy pump : 10.4 ml/sec
lower flow rates endoscopy pump : 1.7 ml/sec

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare the cecal intubation rate between two endoscopy
      water pump with different flow rates (1.7 ml/sec vs 10.4 ml/sec) in water immersion
      colonoscopy examination in unsedated patients undergoing diagnostic colonoscopy.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Endoscopy Water Pump Flow Rates on Successful Unsedated Colonoscopy by Water Immersion Method: a Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.condition: Effect of Endoscopy Water Pump Flow Rates

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult > 18 years old with indication for colonoscopy, such as chronic diarrhea,
             chronic constipation, hematochezia, chronic lower abdominal pain, positive fecal
             occult blood test, and other change of bowel habit symptoms indicative of need for
             diagnostic colonoscopy examination

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients refuse to participate, patient with obstructive lesion in the colon distal
             of the cecum, patients with experienced of colon resection, hemodynamically unstable,
             severe cardiac disorders (such as acute myocardial infarction, unstable angina,
             malignant arrhythmia, and moderate to severe congestive heart failure), patients with
             fecal obstruction (whatever the causes) so that impossible to pass the scope through
             the obstructed segment.

intervention.description: higher flow rates endoscopy pump water immersion colonoscopy : 10.4 ml/sec
lower flow rates endoscopy pump water immersion colonoscopy : 1.7 ml/sec

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Endoscopy Water Pump Flow Rates on Successful Unsedated Colonoscopy by Water Immersion Method: a Randomized Controlled Trial

overall_official.affiliation: Div of Gastroenterology and Hepatology, Dept of Internal Medicine,Fac of Medicine, Gadjah Mada University/Dr.Sardjito General Hospital,Yogyakarta,Indonesia
